result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin G Seitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 11/16/15 and each month thereafter or penalty of 5 days jail for non-payment.

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Kevin G Seitz did not appear.  Authorization previously filed. Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Count #3 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  Guilty plea entered.  Counts 1 & 2 dismissed and read-in. Court orders the following:
$416.00 to be paid at $50/month commencing on 11/16/15 or 5 days jail for penalty for non payment of fine.
